title: Logarithms to an arbitrary base
content: Define "log using an arbitrary base" function and then prove some of its properties. Note that ` logb ` is generalized to an arbitrary base and arbitrary parameter in ` CC ` , but it doesn't accept infinities as arguments, unlike ` log ` . Metamath doesn't care what letters are used to represent classes. Usually classes begin with the letter "A", but here we use "B" and "X" to more clearly distinguish between "base" and "other parameter of log". There are different ways this could be defined in Metamath. The approach used here is intentionally similar to existing 2-parameter Metamath functions (operations): ` ( B logb X ) ` where ` B ` is the base and ` X ` is the argument of the logarithm function. An alternative would be to support the notational form ` ( ( logb `` B ) `` X ) `; that looks a little more like traditional notation. Such a function ` ( logb `` B ) ` for a fixed base can be obtained in Metamath (without the need for a new definition) by the curry function: ` ( curry logb `` B ) ` , see ~ logbmpt , ~ logbf and ~ logbfval .

blocks.name: clogb
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the logarithm generalized to an arbitrary base.
blocks.origin: const class clogb { logb }

blocks.name: diff.clogb.s
diff.clogb.c
diff.clogb.w
df-logb
blocks.content: Define the ` logb ` operator. This is the logarithm generalized to an arbitrary base. It can be used as ` ( B logb X ) ` for "log base B of X". In the most common traditional notation, base B is a subscript of "log". The definition is according to Wikipedia "Complex logarithm": ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complex_logarithm#Logarithms_to_other_bases (10-Jun-2020). (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 21-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: logbval
blocks.content: Define the value of the ` logb ` function, the logarithm generalized to an arbitrary base, when used as infix. Most Metamath statements select variables in order of their use, but to make the order clearer we use "B" for base and "X" for the argument of the logarithm function here. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 21-Jan-2017.) (Revised by David A. Wheeler, 16-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm logbval(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))), wceq(co(c0, clogb, c1), co(cfv(clog, c1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))))
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1)), c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), clogb, co(cfv(clog, c1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), co(cfv(clog, cv(hs1)), cdiv, cfv(clog, cv(hs0))), co(cfv(clog, cv(hs1)), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)))
  oveq2d(cfv(clog, cv(hs1)), cdiv, cfv(clog, cv(hs0)), cfv(clog, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, clog)
  oveq1d(cfv(clog, cv(hs1)), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0), cfv(clog, c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), c1, clog)
  df-logb(hs0, hs1)
  ovex(cfv(clog, c1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))
  diff.hs0.c(co(cfv(clog, c1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1)))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))
  diff.hs1.c(co(cfv(clog, c1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm logbval(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 })∧ c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))→(c0[logb]c1)=((log ` c1)[÷](log ` c0)))
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, (ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c1, (ℂ \ { 0 }), clogb, ((log ` c1)[÷](log ` c0)), ((log ` hs1)[÷](log ` hs0)), ((log ` hs1)[÷](log ` c0)))
  oveq2d((log ` hs1), cdiv, (log ` hs0), (log ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, clog)
  oveq1d((log ` hs1), cdiv, (log ` c0), (log ` c1), hs1 = c1)
  fveq2(hs1, c1, clog)
  df-logb(hs0, hs1)
  ovex((log ` c1), cdiv, (log ` c0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((ℂ \ { 0, 1 }))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((ℂ \ { 0 }))
  diff.hs0.c(((log ` c1)[÷](log ` c0)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c((ℂ \ { 0, 1 }))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c((ℂ \ { 0 }))
  diff.hs1.c(((log ` c1)[÷](log ` c0)))
}

blocks.name: logbcl
blocks.content: General logarithm closure. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 17-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm logbcl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))), wcel(co(c0, clogb, c1), cc))
} = {
  eqeltrd(co(c0, clogb, c1), cc, co(cfv(clog, c1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))))
  logbval(c0, c1)
  divcld(cfv(clog, c1), cfv(clog, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc))
  sylbi(wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0)))
  eldifsn(c1, cc, nat0)
  logcl(c1)
  adantr(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc))
  logcld(c0, wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))))
  eldifi(c0, cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))
  simp2bi(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat1))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wne(cfv(clog, c0), nat0))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wne(cfv(clog, c0), nat0), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  logccne0(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm logbcl(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 })∧ c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))→(c0[logb]c1)∈ ℂ)
} = {
  eqeltrd((c0[logb]c1), cc, ((log ` c1)[÷](log ` c0)), (c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 })∧ c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 })))
  logbval(c0, c1)
  divcld((log ` c1), (log ` c0), (c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 })∧ c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 })))
  adantl(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), (log ` c1)∈ ℂ)
  sylbi(c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), (log ` c1)∈ ℂ, (c1 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ≠ 0))
  eldifsn(c1, cc, nat0)
  logcl(c1)
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), (log ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  logcld(c0, c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }))
  eldifi(c0, cc, { 0, 1 })
  simp2bi(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c0 ≠ 0, c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 1)
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), (log ` c0)≠ 0)
  sylbi(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), (log ` c0)≠ 0, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  logccne0(c0)
}

blocks.name: logbid1
blocks.content: General logarithm is 1 when base and arg match. Property 1(a) of [Cohen4] p. 361. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Sep-2014.) (Revised by David A. Wheeler, 22-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm logbid1(class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), wceq(co(c0, clogb, c0), nat1))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c0, clogb, c0), nat1, co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), wceq(co(c0, clogb, c0), co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  biimpri(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))))
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  biimpri(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  eldifsn(c0, cc, nat0)
  logbval(c0, c0)
  dividd(cfv(clog, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc))
  logcl(c0)
  logccne0(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm logbid1(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1)→(c0[logb]c0)= 1)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0[logb]c0), nat1, ((log ` c0)[÷](log ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1), (c0[logb]c0)=((log ` c0)[÷](log ` c0)), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  biimpri((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }))
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c0 ≠ 1, c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  biimpri((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  eldifsn(c0, cc, nat0)
  logbval(c0, c0)
  dividd((log ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c0 ≠ 1, (log ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  logcl(c0)
  logccne0(c0)
}

blocks.name: logb1
blocks.content: The logarithm of ` 1 ` to an arbitrary base ` B ` is 0. Property 1(b) of [Cohen4] p. 361. See ~ log1 . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Sep-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm logb1(class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), wceq(co(c0, clogb, nat1), nat0))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c0, clogb, nat1), nat0, co(cfv(clog, nat1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  sylbir(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), wceq(co(c0, clogb, nat1), co(cfv(clog, nat1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))))
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  mpan2(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wceq(co(c0, clogb, nat1), co(cfv(clog, nat1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))), wcel(nat1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  mpbir2an(wcel(nat1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(nat1, cc), wne(nat1, nat0))
  ax-1cn()
  ax-1ne0()
  eldifsn(nat1, cc, nat0)
  logbval(c0, nat1)
  syl5eq(co(cfv(clog, nat1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), nat0, co(nat0, cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  oveq1i(cfv(clog, nat1), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0), nat0)
  log1()
  div0d(cfv(clog, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  logcld(c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1))
  logccne0(c0)
}

thm logb1(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1)→(c0[logb]1)= 0)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0[logb]1), nat0, ((log ` 1)[÷](log ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  sylbir((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1), (c0[logb]1)=((log ` 1)[÷](log ` c0)), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }))
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  mpan2(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), (c0[logb]1)=((log ` 1)[÷](log ` c0)), 1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  mpbir2an(1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), 1 ∈ ℂ, 1 ≠ 0)
  ax-1cn()
  ax-1ne0()
  eldifsn(nat1, cc, nat0)
  logbval(c0, nat1)
  syl5eq(((log ` 1)[÷](log ` c0)), nat0, (0[÷](log ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  oveq1i((log ` 1), cdiv, (log ` c0), nat0)
  log1()
  div0d((log ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  logcld(c0, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0 ∧ c0 ≠ 1))
  simp1(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c0 ≠ 1)

}

blocks.name: elogb
blocks.content: The general logarithm of a number to the base being Euler's constant is the natural logarithm of the number. Put another way, using ` _e ` as the base in ` logb ` is the same as ` log ` . Definition in [Cohen4] p. 352. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 17-Oct-2017.) (Revised by David A. Wheeler and AV, 16-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm elogb(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wceq(co(ceu, clogb, c0), cfv(clog, c0)))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(ceu, clogb, c0), cfv(clog, c0), co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, ceu)), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wceq(co(ceu, clogb, c0), co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, ceu))), wcel(ceu, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))))
  mpbir3an(wcel(ceu, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(ceu, cc), wne(ceu, nat0), wne(ceu, nat1))
  recni(ceu)
  ere()
  ene0()
  ene1()
  eldifpr(ceu, cc, nat0, nat1)
  logbval(ceu, c0)
  syl5eq(co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, ceu)), cfv(clog, c0), co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, nat1), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  oveq2i(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, ceu), nat1)
  loge()
  div1d(cfv(clog, c0), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  eldifsn(c0, cc, nat0)
  logcl(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elogb(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 })→(e[logb]c0)=(log ` c0))
} = {
  eqtrd((e[logb]c0), (log ` c0), ((log ` c0)[÷](log ` e)), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  mpan(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), (e[logb]c0)=((log ` c0)[÷](log ` e)), e ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }))
  mpbir3an(e ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), e ∈ ℂ, e ≠ 0, e ≠ 1)
  recni(ceu)
  ere()
  ene0()
  ene1()
  eldifpr(ceu, cc, nat0, nat1)
  logbval(ceu, c0)
  syl5eq(((log ` c0)[÷](log ` e)), (log ` c0), ((log ` c0)[÷]1), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  oveq2i((log ` c0), cdiv, (log ` e), nat1)
  loge()
  div1d((log ` c0), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  sylbi(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }), (log ` c0)∈ ℂ, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  eldifsn(c0, cc, nat0)
  logcl(c0)
}

blocks.name: logbchbase
blocks.content: Change of base for logarithms. Property in [Cohen4] p. 367. (Contributed by AV, 11-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm logbchbase(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))), wceq(co(c0, clogb, c2), co(co(c1, clogb, c2), cdiv, co(c1, clogb, c0))))
} = {
  3eqtr4rd(co(c0, clogb, c2), co(co(c1, clogb, c2), cdiv, co(c1, clogb, c0)), co(co(cfv(clog, c2), cdiv, cfv(clog, c1)), cdiv, co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, c1))), co(cfv(clog, c2), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0)), w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))))
  syl3anc(w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))), wceq(co(co(cfv(clog, c2), cdiv, cfv(clog, c1)), cdiv, co(cfv(clog, c0), cdiv, cfv(clog, c1))), co(cfv(clog, c2), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c2), cc), wa(wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc), wne(cfv(clog, c0), nat0)), wa(wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc), wne(cfv(clog, c1), nat0)))
  3ad2ant3(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c2), cc))
  sylbi(wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wcel(cfv(clog, c2), cc), wa(wcel(c2, cc), wne(c2, nat0)))
  eldifsn(c2, cc, nat0)
  logcl(c2)
  3ad2ant1(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wa(wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc), wne(cfv(clog, c0), nat0)))
  jca(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc), wne(cfv(clog, c0), nat0))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1), wcel(cfv(clog, c0), cc))
  logcl(c0)
  logccne0(c0)
  3ad2ant2(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(c2, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))), wa(wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc), wne(cfv(clog, c1), nat0)))
  jca(w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1)), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc), wne(cfv(clog, c1), nat0))
  3adant3(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat1), wcel(cfv(clog, c1), cc))
  logcl(c1)
  logccne0(c1)

blocks.name: relogbcxpb
blocks.content: The logarithm is the inverse of the exponentiation. Observation in [Cohen4] p. 348. (Contributed by AV, 11-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm relogbcxpb(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c2, cr)), wb(wceq(co(c0, clogb, c1), c2), wceq(co(c0, ccxp, c2), c1)))
} = {

  eqcoms(co(c0, clogb, c1), c2, wceq(co(c0, ccxp, c2), co(c0, ccxp, co(c0, clogb, c1))))
  oveq2(c2, co(c0, clogb, c1), c0, ccxp)
  syl(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c2, cr)), wceq(co(c0, ccxp, co(c0, clogb, c1)), c1), wa(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))))
  3adant3(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c2, cr), wa(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)))))
  anim12i(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c1, cdif(cc, csn(nat0))))
  syl3anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(nat0, nat1))), wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1))
  adantr(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cc))
  rpcn(c0)
  adantr(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1), wne(c0, nat0))
  rpne0(c0)
  simpr(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1))

  cxplogb(c0, c1)
  sylan9eqr(co(c0, clogb, c1), c2, co(c0, clogb, co(c0, ccxp, c2)), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c2, cr)), wceq(co(c0, ccxp, c2), c1))
  eqcoms(co(c0, ccxp, c2), c1, wceq(co(c0, clogb, c1), co(c0, clogb, co(c0, ccxp, c2))))

  3adant2(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c2, cr), wa(wcel(c0, cdif(crp, csn(nat1))), wcel(c2, cr)))

  biimpri(wa(wcel(c0, crp), wne(c0, nat1)), wcel(c0, cdif(crp, csn(nat1))))

  3adant3((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c1 ∈ ℝ+, c2 ∈ ℝ, (c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 })∧ c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 })))
  anim12i((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c1 ∈ ℝ+, c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c1 ∈(ℂ \ { 0 }))
  syl3anbrc((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { 0, 1 }), c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, c0 ≠ 1)
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ+, c0 ≠ 1, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  rpcn(c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ+, c0 ≠ 1, c0 ≠ 0)
  rpne0(c0)
  simpr(c0 ∈ ℝ+, c0 ≠ 1)
  eldifpr(c0, cc, nat0, nat1)
  rpcndif0(c1)
  cxplogb(c0, c1)
  sylan9eqr((c0[logb]c1), c2, (c0[logb](c0[^c]c2)), ((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ), (c0[^c]c2)= c1)
  eqcoms((c0[^c]c2), c1, (c0[logb]c1)=(c0[logb](c0[^c]c2)))
  oveq2(c1, (c0[^c]c2), c0, clogb)
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1)∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ), (c0[logb](c0[^c]c2))= c2, (c0 ∈(ℝ+ \ { 1 })∧ c2 ∈ ℝ))
  3adant2((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c1 ∈ ℝ+, c2 ∈ ℝ, (c0 ∈(ℝ+ \ { 1 })∧ c2 ∈ ℝ))
  anim1i((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c2 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈(ℝ+ \ { 1 }))
  biimpri((c0 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c0 ≠ 1), c0 ∈(ℝ+ \ { 1 }))
  eldifsn(c0, crp, nat1)

thm logbmpt(setvar s0, class c0) {

  eqtrd(cfv(ccur(clogb), c0), cmpt(s0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), co(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), cdiv, cfv(clog, c0))), cmpt(s0, cdif(cc, csn(nat0)), csb(hs0, c0, co(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), cdiv, cfv(clog, cv(hs0))))), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat1)))

blocks.name: 2irrexpqALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ 2irrexpq : There exist irrational numbers ` a ` and ` b ` such that ` ( a ^ b ) ` is rational. Statement in the Metamath book, section 1.1.5, footnote 27 on page 17, and the "constructive proof" for theorem 1.2 of [Bauer], p. 483. In contrast to ~ 2irrexpq , this is a constructive proof because it is based on two explicitly named irrational numbers ` ( sqrt `` 2 ) ` and ` ( 2 logb 9 ) ` , see ~ sqrt2irr0 , ~ 2logb9irr and ~ sqrt2cxp2logb9e3 . Therefore, this proof is also acceptable/usable in intuitionistic logic. (Contributed by AV, 23-Dec-2022.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
